info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 12:40AM EDT until June 28 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
FFWFFC
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Bibb County in central Georgia... East Central Crawford County in central Georgia... Northeastern Peach County in central Georgia...
* Until 345 AM EDT.
* At 1240 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Macon, Warner Robins, Byron, Payne, Payne City, Skipperton, Rutland, Jack Brown Estates, Powerville, Lakewood, Cross Keys and Miami Valley.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Bibb, GA; Crawford, GA; Peach, GA
